comment._content: Bethune, Sir Edward Cecil (1855-1930) Lieutenant-General From - the Harmsworth Encyclopedia c.1910 Bethune was born in 1855 and began his military career in 1875. He received his captaincy in Feb 1884, and was promoted to Lieutenant-colonel in 1900. He served in the Afghan War of 1878-80, and was present at the operations around Cabul in Dec 1875, for which he received the medal with clasp. He served through the Boer War of 1881, and also that of 1899-1902, in which he raised and commanded Bethune's mounted infantry (1899-1900), better known perhaps as 'Bethune's Horse'. yourarchives.nationalarchives.gov.uk/index.php?title=Beth...(1855-1930)_Lieutenant-General General Officer Commanding, West Lancashire Div, Western Command 1909-1912; Director General, Territorial Force 1912-1917; World War I 1914-1918; retired 1920; Col, 4 Royal Irish Dragoon Guards 1908-1920 www.kcl.ac.uk/lhcma/locreg/BETHUNE.shtml
